lines.content: * Drives the execution of the Jerry task management application.
/** Handles user interaction such as reading input and displaying messages or error messages. */
/** Stores and manages the user's tasks. */
* Constructs a {@code Jerry} instance and initializes storage and task data.
* If loading from storage fails, an empty task list is used.
* Runs the main program loop to process user commands until the user exits.
* Represents the set of valid command keywords supported by Jerry.
* Each enum constant corresponds to a command a user can enter (e.g., {@code todo}, {@code list}).
* Returns the {@code Commands} enum that matches the given user command input.
* The matching is case-insensitive (e.g., {@code "todo"} and {@code "TODO"} both match {@link #TODO}).
* @param userCommandInput The raw command keyword entered by the user.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If {@code userCommandInput} does not match any supported command keyword.
public static Commands getCommand(String userCommandInput) throws InvalidCommandException {
* Represents an exception thrown when the saved data file
* contains invalid or corrupted entries that prevent it from being parsed correctly.
* Constructs a {@code CorruptedSavedFileException} with the specified error message
* describing the corruption in the saved file.
* @param outputMessage The message detailing the cause of the file corruption.
* Represents an exception thrown when the user provides an empty input.
* Constructs an {@code EmptyInputException} with a default error message prompting the user to enter a command.
* Represents an exception thrown when a file-related error occurs during reading from or writing to a file.
* Constructs a {@code FileErrorException} with the specified error message describing the file-related error.
* @param outputMessage The message detailing the cause of the file error.
* Represents an exception thrown when the user enters an invalid or unrecognized command.
/** List of valid Commands and their example usages */
"Command: list (to view your tasks in a list)\n"
+ "Command: jerry.task.Deadline <add your task here> /by <ddmmyyyy hhmm (24-hour clock)>\n"
* Constructs an {@code InvalidCommandException} with a default error message
* followed by a list of valid commands and example usages.
* Constructs an {@code InvalidCommandException} with the specified error message
* followed by a list of valid commands and example usages.
* @param outputMessage The error message describing why the command is invalid.
* Represents a general exception that can be thrown when an error occurs.
* This exception serves as the base class for all custom exceptions.
* Constructs a {@code JerryException} with the specified error message.
* @param outputMessage The error message describing the cause of the exception.
* Represents an exception thrown when a required argument for a command is missing from the user input.
* Constructs a {@code MissingArgumentException} with a message indicating
* that a required argument is missing, followed by the correct usage format.
* @param correctUsage The correct usage format of the command.
* Represents an exception thrown when a required file is missing or cannot be accessed.
* Constructs a {@code MissingFileException} with the specified error message describing the missing file.
* @param outputMessage The message detailing the cause of the missing file error.
* Represents an exception thrown when a user attempts to perform an action that has already been applied to a task.
* Constructs a {@code RepeatedActionsException} with the specified error message
* @param outputMessage The message detailing the cause of the repeated action error.
* Represents an exception thrown when a command argument is invalid.
* Constructs a {@code WrongArgumentException} with the specified error message describing the invalid argument.
* @param outputMessage The message detailing why the argument is invalid.
* Parses user input and saved file data into commands and task objects.
* Loads tasks from the specified saved file and adds them to the given task list.
* Each line in the file is parsed into a corresponding {@code Task} based on the expected save file format.
* @param taskFile The file containing the saved task data.
* @param taskList The list to which the parsed tasks will be added.
* @return The updated task list containing all loaded tasks.
* @throws JerryException If the file is missing, inaccessible, contains corrupted or invalid task data.
public static ArrayList<Task> loadTasksFromFile(File taskFile, ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws JerryException {
throw new CorruptedSavedFileException("There is no such task type.\n"
throw new CorruptedSavedFileException("The jerry.Jerry.txt file seems to be corrupted :(\n"
+ "There could be invalid entries in it.\n");
throw new MissingFileException("Oh noo!!! jerry.Jerry.txt file is missing or inaccessible.\n"
+ "Please make sure that jerry.Jerry.txt is in the data/ directory and that it is writable.\n");
"The data time format of one of the entries in jerry.Jerry.txt seems to be corrupted\n"
+ "Please ensure that it is in <yyyy-mm-dd>T<hh-mm> format (24-hour clock).\n"
* Returns a {@code ToDo} task parsed from the given task description.
* The description is validated to ensure it is non-empty and does not
* @param taskDescription The description of the to-do task.
* @return A {@code ToDo} task created from the given description.
* @throws JerryException If the description is empty or contains invalid characters.
public static Task parseTodo(String taskDescription) throws JerryException {
throw new MissingArgumentException("todo <your task goes here>\n");
throw new WrongArgumentException("Character '|' is not allowed in your task description.\n");
* Returns a {@code Deadline} task parsed from the given user input.
* The input is validated to ensure it contains a task description
* and a valid deadline specified using the {@code /by} delimiter.
* @param userInput The raw user input containing the deadline task description and due date.
* @return A {@code Deadline} task created from the parsed input.
* @throws JerryException If required arguments are missing,
*              invalid characters are present or the date-time format is incorrect.
public static Task parseDeadline(String userInput) throws JerryException {
throw new WrongArgumentException("Character '|' is not allowed in your input.\n");
return new Deadline(taskDescription, LocalDateTime.parse(by, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("ddMMyyyy HHmm")));
throw new MissingArgumentException("deadline <your task goes here> /by <ddmmyyyy hhmm (24-hour clock)>\n");
throw new WrongArgumentException("There is issue with your date and time format.\n"
* Returns an {@code Event} task parsed from the given user input.
* The input is validated to ensure it contains a task description, a start time
* specified using {@code /from}, and an end time specified using {@code /to},
* with the start time occurring before the end time.
* @param userInput The raw user input containing the event description, start time, and end time.
* @return An {@code Event} task created from the parsed input.
* @throws JerryException If there are missing arguments,
*              invalid characters, incorrect date-time format or the time range is wrong
public static Task parseEvent(String userInput) throws JerryException {
throw new WrongArgumentException("Character '|' is not allowed in your input.\n");
+ "Your start time must be before end time\n");

* Returns the zero-based array index parsed from the given user input array.

public static int getArrayIndex(String[] userInputArray) throws JerryException {

throw new MissingArgumentException("Mark <your task index from list>\n"
* Returns the validated search query extracted from user input.
* The query must be non-empty to be considered valid.
* @param searchQuery The raw search query provided by the user.

public static String getSearchQuery(String searchQuery) throws JerryException {
throw new MissingArgumentException("Please enter a search query.\n"
* Handles loading and saving of task data to storage.
/** Path to the file used for storing task data. */
private static final Path FILE_PATH = Path.of("data/Jerry.txt");
* Returns a list of tasks loaded from the saved data file.
* If the data file does not exist, it is created and an empty list is returned.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from storage.
* @throws JerryException If the file cannot be created, accessed, or contains corrupted data.
public static ArrayList<Task> initialise() throws JerryException {
throw new FileErrorException("Failed trying to create data/ directory.\n"
+ "Please ensure that the folder is writable.");
throw new FileErrorException("There is an I/O error when creating jerry.Jerry.txt.\n"
+ "Please make sure that the folder is writable.\n");
throw new FileErrorException("There seems to be some issue with the permissions of the folder/file.\n"
+ "Please make sure that the folder/file is writable.\n");
* Saves the given task list to the data file in the expected file format.
* Existing file contents will be overwritten.
* @param taskList The task list to be saved to storage.
* @throws JerryException If an error occurs while writing to the data file or creating the parent directory
public static void save(TaskList taskList) throws JerryException {
throw new FileErrorException("Failed trying to create data/ directory.\n"
+ "Please ensure that the folder is writable.");
throw new FileErrorException("There seems to be an error when writing to jerry.Jerry.txt.\n"
+ "Please make sure that data/jerry.Jerry.txt exist and is writable.\n");
throw new FileErrorException("There seems to be some issue with the permissions of the folder/file.\n"
+ "Please make sure that the folder/file is writable.\n");
* Represents a task that must be completed by a specific date and time.
* A {@code Deadline} task extends {@code Task} by including a due date.
/** The date and time by which the task must be completed. */
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the specified description
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The date and time by which the task must be completed.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the specified completion status,
* @param isDone Whether the task is marked as completed.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The date and time by which the task must be completed.
public Deadline(boolean isDone, String description, LocalDateTime by) {
* Returns the file representation of this deadline task in the expected save file format.
* @return A formatted string describing this deadline task in file storage format.
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task.
* @return A formatted string describing this deadline task.
* Represents a task that occurs over a specific period of time.
* An {@code Event} task extends {@code Task} by including a start time
/** The start date and time of the event. */
/** The end date and time of the event. */
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the specified description,
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from The start date and time of the event.
* @param to The end date and time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the specified completion status,
* description, start time, and end time.
* @param isDone Whether the task is marked as completed.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from The start date and time of the event.
* @param to The end date and time of the event.
public Event(boolean isDone, String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Returns the file representation of this event task in the expected save file format.

* Returns a string representation of this event task.
* @return A formatted string describing this event task.
* Represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.
* This class serves as the base type for all specific task implementations.
/** Indicates whether the task has been marked as completed. */
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not completed.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified completion status
* @param isDone Whether the task is marked as completed.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon representing whether this task is completed.
* @return {@code "X"} if the task is completed, or a blank space otherwise.
* Toggles the completion status of this task.
* Returns whether this task is marked as completed.
* @return {@code true} if the task is completed, or {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns the file representation of this task in the expected save file format.
* @return A string representing this task in file storage format.
* Returns a string representation of this task.
* @return A formatted string describing this task.

* The match is performed by checking if the task description contains the query.
* @param searchQuery The search keyword to match against the task description.
* @return {@code true} if the task matches the search query, or {@code false} otherwise.

* Returns the task at the specified zero-based index.

* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws JerryException If the index is out of range.
public Task get(int index) throws JerryException {
: ("Please enter a number in the range of 1 to " + this.taskList.size()))

* Deletes the task at the specified zero-based index.

* Unmarks the task at the specified zero-based index as not done.

public Task unmarkTask(int targetIndex) throws JerryException {
throw new RepeatedActionsException("You've made a mistake, "
+ " is already unmarked as not done yet\n");
* Adds the specified task to this task list.
* Returns the number of tasks in this task list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Returns whether this task list contains no tasks.

* Returns a formatted list of all tasks with one-based indices for display.

* Returns a list of tasks whose descriptions match the given search query.
* The matching logic is delegated to each task.
* @param searchQuery The keyword used to search for matching tasks.

* @param isDone Whether the task is marked as completed.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.

* @return A string representing this todo task in file storage format.
* Returns a string representation of this todo task.
* @return A formatted string describing this todo task.

* Displays the welcome message to the user.

System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
